query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 In su l’estremità d’un’alta ripa 2 che facevan gran pietre rotte in cerchio, 3 venimmo sopra più crudele stipa;
query.error: **English:** 1 On the edge of a high bank 2 made of large broken rocks in a circle, 3 we came upon a more cruel throng;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 e quivi, per l’orribile soperchio 5 del puzzo che ’l profondo abisso gitta, 6 ci raccostammo, in dietro, ad un coperchio
query.error: **English:** 4 and there, because of the horrible stench 5 that the deep abyss cast forth, 6 we drew back, behind a lid
query.result: 4 hagena, rag an soperchio orth 5 a'n boesow orth a dheuth an downder, 6 ni a dheuth yn-nans, yn-nans dhe'n kovor

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 d’un grand’ avello, ov’ io vidi una scritta 8 che dicea: ‘Anastasio papa guardo, 9 lo qual trasse Fotin de la via dritta’.
query.error: **English:** 7 of a large tomb, where I saw an inscription 8 that said: ‘Pope Anastasius I guard, 9 whom Photinus drew from the straight path’.
query.result: 7 avel mawr, le may hwelasow skrif 8 ow leverel: ‘Anastasius an pab a wylas, 9 neb a dheuth Fotin a'n fordh unys’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 «Lo nostro scender conviene esser tardo, 11 sì che s’ausi un poco in prima il senso 12 al tristo fiato; e poi no i fia riguardo».
query.error: **English:** 10 “Our descent must be slow, 11 so that the sense may grow somewhat accustomed 12 to the foul stench; and then it will not matter”.
query.result: 10 “An diskennans a wra dhe bos marthys, 11 marow henna’n sens a wra dhe vos marthys 12 dhe’n froth trist; hagena nyns yw marthys”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Così ’l maestro; e io «Alcun compenso», 14 dissi lui, «trova che ’l tempo non passi 15 perduto». Ed elli: «Vedi ch’a ciò penso».
query.error: **English:** 13 Thus the master; and I said to him, “Find some way 14 so that time is not wasted”. And he: “See that I am thinking about that”.
query.result: 13 Marow henna’n mester; ha my a leveris, 14 “Kavos an fordh a wra dhe’n termyn nyns yw 15 kellys”. Ha henna: “Gweles henna’m owthynna”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 «Figliuol mio, dentro da cotesti sassi», 17 cominciò poi a dir, «son tre cerchietti 18 di grado in grado, come que’ che lassi.
query.error: **English:** 16 "My son, within these rocks," 17 he then began to say, "are three small circles, 18 of grade in grade, like those that you left behind.
query.result: 16 "Mab an vy, a-ves an menydh ma, 17 a leveris, "ef a leveris, "tre gelhynnygow, 18 a-ugh yn ugh, kepar ha'n re a-gasas."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 Tutti son pien di spirti maladetti; 20 ma perché poi ti basti pur la vista, 21 intendi come e perché son costretti.
query.error: **English:** 19 All are full of cursed spirits; 20 but so that the sight of them may suffice you, 21 understand how and why they are constrained.
query.result: 19 Leun a-ugh leun a spyrysow drog, 20 mes rag nans yw dos pur an golwg, 21 komprehendya fenten ha'gas yw kemerys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 D’ogne malizia, ch’odio in cielo acquista, 23 ingiuria è ’l fine, ed ogne fin cotale 24 o con forza o con frode altrui contrista.
query.error: **English:** 22 Of every malice that acquires hatred in heaven, 23 injury is the end, and every such end 24 either by force or by fraud works sorrow on others.
query.result: 22 A bubel drok, owth a-gas an keth yn-dann an nef, 23 an drogasow yw an diwedh, ha bubel diwedh kepar 24 po gans po gans froth a-gas an keth aral.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Ma perché frode è de l’uom proprio male, 26 più spiace a Dio; e però stan di sotto 27 li frodolenti, e più dolor li assale.
query.error: **English:** 25 But because fraud is man's own special evil, 26 it is more displeasing to God; and therefore the fraudulent are placed below, 27 and greater pain assails them.
query.result: 25 Mes rag frodh yw drog arbennek an den, 26 moyha spys dhe Dhew; ha dre henna yma'n 27 an frodhoryon y'n isella, ha moyha dolur a's tas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Di vïolenti il primo cerchio è tutto; 29 ma perché si fa forza a tre persone, 30 in tre gironi è distinto e costrutto.
query.error: **English:** 28 The first circle is entirely of the violent; 29 but because violence can be done to three persons, 30 it is divided and constructed into three rings.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 A Dio, a sé, al prossimo si pòne 32 far forza, dico in loro e in lor cose, 33 come udirai con aperta ragione.
query.error: **English:** 31 Violence can be done to God, to oneself, and to one's neighbor, 32 I mean in their persons and in their possessions, 33 as you will hear with clear reasoning.
query.result: 31 Dhe Dhew, dhe'n honan ha dhe'n nessa 32 yllir nerth bos gwrys, me a lever, 33 kepar ha klyvsydh gans reson kler.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Morte per forza e ferute dogliose 35 nel prossimo si danno, e nel suo avere 36 ruine, incendi e tollette dannose;
query.error: **English:** 34 Violent death and painful wounds 35 are inflicted on one's neighbor, and on his possessions 36 ruin, fires, and harmful thefts;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 onde omicide e ciascun che mal fiere, 38 guastatori e predon, tutti tormenta 39 lo giron primo per diverse schiere.
query.error: **English:** 37 therefore murderers and all who inflict evil wounds, 38 ravagers and plunderers, are all tormented 39 in the first ring, in different bands.
query.result: 37 dre henna losow ha pubonan a wra 38 gwaytys ha ladron, oll a wra tormentow 39 an kynsa kelgh, y'n bagasow dyffrans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 Puote omo avere in sé man vïolenta 41 e ne’ suoi beni; e però nel secondo 42 giron convien che sanza pro si penta
query.error: **English:** 40 A man can commit violent acts against himself 41 and against his own possessions; and therefore in the second 42 ring it is necessary that he repent without hope of reward,
query.result: 40 Yllir den bos nerth dhe'n honan 41 ha dhe'y gevyans; ha dre henna y'n 42 an nessa kelgh yma bos redys dhe benans

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 qualunque priva sé del vostro mondo, 44 biscazza e fonde la sua facultade, 45 e piange là dov’ esser de’ giocondo.
query.error: **English:** 43 Whoever deprives himself of your world, 44 squanders and wastes his faculty, 45 and weeps there where he should be joyful.
query.result: 43 Pyth yw hemma bos ogas, oll yw van 44 agan deall; ha mar ny wra erel agan purtya, 45 ny wodha ni tra veur agas stat denel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Puossi far forza ne la deïtade, 47 col cor negando e bestemmiando quella, 48 e spregiando natura e sua bontade;
query.error: **English:** 46 One can exert force against the deity, 47 with the heart denying and blaspheming it, 48 and scorning nature and its goodness;
query.result: 46 Yma gallos gwruthyl yn erbyn an Duw, 47 gans an kalon ow tynkya ha'y gondemnya, 48 ha gans despysi an termyn ha'y da.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 e però lo minor giron suggella 50 del segno suo e Soddoma e Caorsa 51 e chi, spregiando Dio col cor, favella.
query.error: **English:** 49 and therefore the smaller circle seals 50 with its mark Sodom and Cahors 51 and those who, scorning God with their heart, speak.
query.result: 49 Ha dre henna an keth chyf a-ugh 50 gans y merk Sodom ha Caorsa 51 ha'n re, gans despysi Duw gans aga kalon, a lever.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 La frode, ond’ ogne coscïenza è morsa, 53 può l’omo usare in colui che ’n lui fida 54 e in quel che fidanza non imborsa.
query.error: **English:** 52 Fraud, by which every conscience is bitten, 53 a man can use against one who trusts in him 54 and against one who does not take trust into account.
query.result: 52 An frodh, drehev pub coscyens yw keyn, 53 a yll den omdh usya ynno onan a fydh ynno, 54 ha ynno onan na wra fydh ynno yn-count.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 Questo modo di retro par ch’incida 56 pur lo vinco d’amor che fa natura; 57 onde nel cerchio secondo s’annida
query.error: **English:** 55 This way of going backward so that it may cut 56 still conquers love, which nature makes; 57 whence in the second circle nestle

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 ipocresia, lusinghe e chi affattura, 59 falsità, ladroneccio e simonia, 60 ruffian, baratti e simile lordura.
query.error: **English:** 58 hypocrisy, flattery, and those who bewitch, 59 falsehood, theft, and simony, 60 pimps, barrators, and similar filth.
query.result: 58 an golladow, lowennow ha'n re beud, 59 falstedh, ladroneth ha simonia, 60 ruffianes, baratti ha fordhow keth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Per l’altro modo quell’ amor s’oblia 62 che fa natura, e quel ch’è poi aggiunto, 63 di che la fede spezïal si cria;
query.error: **English:** 61 By the other way that love is forgotten 62 which nature makes, and that which is then added, 63 from which special faith is created;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 onde nel cerchio minore, ov’ è ’l punto 65 de l’universo in su che Dite siede, 66 qualunque trade in etterno è consunto».
query.error: **English:** 64 whence in the smaller circle, where is the point 65 of the universe on which Dis sits, 66 whoever betrays is eternally consumed.
query.result: 64 rag y'n kethrans byghan, le mayth an poynt 65 a'n bys vyth orth henna yma Dite, 66 pub onan a wra treys y'n konsumys byth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 E io: «Maestro, assai chiara procede 68 la tua ragione, e assai ben distingue 69 questo baràtro e ’l popol ch’e’ possiede.
query.error: **English:** 67 And I: "Master, your reasoning proceeds very clearly, 68 and it distinguishes very well 69 this abyss and the people who possess it.
query.result: 67 Ha my: "Mester, klerhe dheg yw mos dha reson, 68 ha dheg dha yw dystynnya 69 an baratro ma ha'n bobel a'n possessa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Ma dimmi: quei de la palude pingue, 71 che mena il vento, e che batte la pioggia, 72 e che s’incontran con sì aspre lingue,
query.error: **English:** 70 But tell me: those in the fat marsh, 71 whom the wind drives and the rain beats, 72 and who clash with such harsh tongues,
query.result: 70 Mes dywedh vy: henna y'n palud ping, 71 a wra'n gwyns gans an gwyns, ha'n glaw a wra'n sketh, 72 ha'n wra'n omweli gans teylow kergh,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 perché non dentro da la città roggia 74 sono ei puniti, se Dio li ha in ira? 75 e se non li ha, perché sono a tal foggia?».
query.error: **English:** 73 why are they not punished inside the red city, 74 if God is angry with them? 75 And if he is not, why are they in such a state?
query.result: 73 prag ytho esa ponsys y'n cita rudh, 74 mar yw Dew dheg dhe wroth? 75 Ha mar nad yw, prag ytho esa y'n fordh ma?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Ed elli a me «Perché tanto delira», 77 disse, «lo ’ngegno tuo da quel che sòle? 78 o ver la mente dove altrove mira?
query.error: **English:** 76 And he said to me, "Why do you rave so much," 77 he said, "your intellect from what it usually does? 78 Or does your mind look elsewhere?
query.result: 76 Ha henna dhymm, "Perag kemmys owth delira", 77 henna a leveris, "ow 'ngegno dhyworth henna a wodhaf? 78 po ow'th menow a wra yn le mayn erel?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Non ti rimembra di quelle parole 80 con le quai la tua Etica pertratta 81 le tre disposizion che ’l ciel non vole,
query.error: **English:** 79 Don't you remember those words 80 with which your Ethics discusses 81 the three dispositions that Heaven does not want,
query.result: 79 Na'th kov dhe'th owth kov henna gerow 80 gans ow'th Etika a leveris 81 an tair disposisyon na wodh an nef a gar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 incontenenza, malizia e la matta 83 bestialitade? e come incontenenza 84 men Dio offende e men biasimo accatta?
query.error: **English:** 82 incontinence, malice and mad 83 bestiality? And how incontinence 84 offends God less and attracts less blame?
query.result: 82 Incontinenza, malizia ha'n matta 83 bestialitade? Ha kemmys owth incontenenza 84 a offenda Duw le ha'n biasimo ackatta?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 Se tu riguardi ben questa sentenza, 86 e rechiti a la mente chi son quelli 87 che sù di fuor sostegnon penitenza,
query.error: **English:** 85 If you look closely at this statement, 86 and bring to mind who those are 87 who endure penance up there outside,
query.result: 85 Marth owth wra yn da'th henna sentenza, 86 ha'n rechitis dhe'th menow pandra henna 87 pandra a wra yn uhella sostenon penitenza,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 tu vedrai ben perché da questi felli 89 sien dipartiti, e perché men crucciata 90 la divina vendetta li martelli».
query.error: **English:** 88 you will see clearly why from these wicked ones 89 they are separated, and why less harshly 90 divine vengeance hammers them."
query.result: 88 ty a wra gweles da'th perag dhyworth henna felli 89 a wra dipartiti, ha perag le menow crucciata 90 an venjans divina li martelli".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 «O sol che sani ogne vista turbata, 92 tu mi contenti sì quando tu solvi, 93 che, non men che saver, dubbiar m’aggrata.
query.error: **English:** 91 "O sun who heals every troubled sight, 92 you satisfy me so when you solve, 93 that, no less than knowing, doubting pleases me.
query.result: 91 "O sol henna a sani ogne vista turbata, 92 ty a contenti vy felly pan vro solvi, 93 henna, na le menow ages saver, dubbiar m’aggrata.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 Ancora in dietro un poco ti rivolvi», 95 diss’ io, «là dove di’ ch’usura offende 96 la divina bontade, e ’l groppo solvi».

query.result: 94 "Ancora in dietro un poco ti rivolvi", 95 dys io, "là dove di’ ch’usura offende 96 an divina bontade, ha ’l groppo solvi".

97 «Filosofia», mi disse, «a chi la ’ntende, 98 nota, non pure in una sola parte, 99 come natura lo suo corso prende

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 dal divino ’ntelletto e da sua arte; 101 e se tu ben la tua Fisica note, 102 tu troverai, non dopo molte carte,
query.error: **English:** 100 from the divine intellect and from its art; 101 and if you note your Physics well, 102 you will find, not many pages later,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 che l’arte vostra quella, quanto pote, 104 segue, come ’l maestro fa ’l discente; 105 sì che vostr’ arte a Dio quasi è nepote.
query.error: **English:** 103 that your art follows that one, as much as it can, 104 as the master does the student; 105 so that your art is almost a grandchild of God.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Da queste due, se tu ti rechi a mente 107 lo Genesì dal principio, convene 108 prender sua vita e avanzar la gente;
query.error: **English:** 106 From these two, if you recall to mind 107 Genesis from the beginning, it is fitting 108 to take their life and advance the people;
query.result: 106 A-dhiworth an dhew, mar keffrys dhe'th poynt 107 Genesow a'n tressa, ytholl an keffrys 108 kemer aga byw ha bos ogas an dus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 e perché l’usuriere altra via tene, 110 per sé natura e per la sua seguace 111 dispregia, poi ch’in altro pon la spene.
query.error: **English:** 109 and because the usurer takes another way, 110 he despises nature for himself and for his followers, 111 since he places his hope in something else.
query.result: 109 Ha drehevaga'n usurer arall fordh, 110 ev a dhispris aga honan ha'y dusoryon, 111 rag ev a wra aga spyrnans yn fordh arall.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
